ygData.subject: RE: RE: Finally 200
ygData.msgSnippet: You could very well be correct as well... Since I have not done 100 plus data points, we all could be seeing what we want to think is true....  Who really
ygData.messageBody:
You could very well be correct as well... Since I have not done 100 plus
data points, we all could be seeing what we want to think is true.... Who
really knows? Well the guy who wrote the program code knows for sure, and
that's about it.


Vapn, Master Fletcher, Povar
-----Original Message-----
From: Joseph Delan [mailto:jdelan@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 12, 1999 2:30 PM
To: EQ_Fletchers@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Fletchers] RE: Finally 200


From: "Joseph Delan" <jdelan@...>

TO be truthful...I don't think there is a rule on what attribute is used to
help you gain skills...I sat down one day and gained a lvl 7 out of 10 times
with my base INT of 60 or so and Wisdom not much better...I think it's all
just a ratio of your skill to the minimum skill needed to make an
item...It's all chance...

Sheltim, lvl 15, Barbarian warrior, The Rathe
lvl 42 Fletcher

----- Original Message -----
From: Murr Rockstroh <mrockstr@...>
To: <EQ_Fletchers@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 12, 1999 3:05 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Fletchers] RE: Finally 200


> From: "Murr Rockstroh" <mrockstr@...>
>
> I am going to have to disagree here about the Wisdom thing and
failures.....
> This is something that I first heard in Beta.... My wisdom is 74, and my
> Dex is 117, and I don't fail much on Darkwoods (about 33 percent). I
think
> that different skills might take different attributes for success.... My
Int
> is 102 anyways (no suit needed, I am a gnome)
>
> Vapn Maistre, Master Fletcher, Povar
> Level 33 Warrior
>
>
